intro: Proclesia alata, commonly known as the winged morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in the morning and close in the afternoon. The plant has distinctive wing-like structures on its stems, which give it its common name. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, known for its climbing vines and ornamental value. Proclesia alata is often cultivated for its vibrant, trumpet-shaped blooms that come in shades of red, pink, and white.
